document_data.name: Ilbryn Starym
document_data.mainbody: '''Ilbryn Starym''' was an [[elf]] [[wizard]] of the [[Starym]] family during the mid–8{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Personality: Ilbryn Starym had, since the Fall of [[Myth Drannor]], grown obsessed with the elimination of [[Elminster Aumar]].{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|670-672|14}}
document_data.Description:
Ilbryn was slim{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|597-598|6}} and looked young and haughty.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|630|9}} He wore a [[cloak]] of a dark color.

By {{yearlink|764}}, he had taken to wearing dark [[robe]]s.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|624-625|9}} He wore maroon robes in {{yearlink|767}}, and was handsome still.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|651-652|11}} However, half his face was a mass of scars, which was hidden by a spell. The scarring stretched to his armpit and all the way to his knee.
document_data.Possessions:
During {{yearlink|761}}, Ilbryn Starym carried a staff of live wood set with precious gems, at least two of which were green. The staff could be let go to float on its own, trailed black flames when moving on its own, and sometimes lightning. He also carried three [[wand]]s at his hip. Ilbrym claimed the items he was carrying were long venerated in his family.

After {{yearlink|764}}, Ilbryn also carried a scrap of red cloth once of the Court Mage of [[Galadorna]], then Elminster Aumar, which he snatched during the latter's spellbattle with the sorceress [[Dasumia]], then-queen of Galadorna. He also took to carrying a number of weapons, to make his spells more of a surprise.
document_data.Relationships: He had a low opinion of the [[Moondark family]], and believed himself to be the last of his line.
document_data.History:
At some point after the fall of Myth Drannor, Ilbryn Starym believed that all of the hunting lodges of the Starym family had been destroyed leaving him the only survivor. He then settled on the destruction of Elminster Aumar as his overarching goal, with a secondary consideration that he might afterwards sire a new House Starym himself if he succeeded.

In spring of the {{yearlinkName|761}}, while tracking down Elminster, he entered [[Moonshorn Tower]], where after being quite rude to the guardian, [[Mardasper Oblyndrin]], he discovered Elminster's name on the logbook. Reluctantly, the guardian told him where his hated foe had gone; Ilbryn managed to leave without a fight, as the guardian was too meek. Riding in pursuit, he passed the sages [[Tabarast]] and [[Beldrune]], who were in pursuit of Elminster too. He arrived at the [[Castle of the Lady]] not long after Dasumia took Elminster there.

As of {{yearlinkName|764}}, Ilbryn Starym had continued to shadow Elminster during the length of his stay in the [[Castle of the Lady]], though he was never able to get in the castle himself. Upon the coronation of the sorceress Dasumia as queen of Galadorna, Ilbryn learned from the sages Tabarast and Beldrune that Elminster and she had gone elsewhere. He physically pressed one of them for details; the sages responded violently, hurling him away with a strange spell that incapacitated him. The sages shared the details with him afterwards.

During the last day of Dasumia's reign as queen of Galadorna, Ilbryn followed her to the castle from the [[Goblet of Shadows]] tavern.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|638|10}} He suffered severe injuries, which required extensive spellcasting and patching to repair.

Ilbryn Starym followed Elminster to [[Westgate]] in the {{yearlinkName|767}}, where he took a room at the [[Stars and Sword]], a local inn, while hoping to learn of his whereabouts. Afterwards, he rode for six days into [[Ripplestones]], where he learned Elminster had gone into [[the Dead Place]], and headed there immediately. While riding across the Dead Place, he stumbled upon a band of [[adventurer]]s, who attacked him, killing his horse. He successfully slew them all, and then took a sword from them. Afterwards, he came across a group of [[Shar]]ran [[Dreadspells]], led by Dark Brother [[Elryn]]. He slew their guide, and then fled, using a spell to divine their target location, which he reasoned was most likely Elminster's target too.

He prepared himself to ambush his most hated foe in the throne chamber within the depths of [[Karsus' Keep]], delaying his attack because of the unpredictable, powerful magic circles all across the room.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|706|18}} Ilbryn later emerged from hiding to stab [[Saeraede Lyonora]] after she managed to capture and weaken Elminster. He was then slain from her death throes, which unleashed an explosion of such force that it annihilated his body completely.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|731|19}}{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|736-737|19}}
